disease: Sebaceous cell carcinoma of skin of left upper eyelid, including canthus

symptoms.name: Atypical or recurrent chalazia in the upper lid
Keratoconjunctivitis or blepharoconjunctivitis unresponsive to treatment

physical_findings: Yellowish appearance of the lesion (due to lipid within neoplastic cells)
Lesion arises at the sebaceous glands, usually at the lid margin
Possible extension to the palpebral conjunctiva
Diffuse thickening of lid margin (in spreading variety)
risk_factors: Older age (median age at presentation between 57 and 72 years)

required: Histopathological examination showing characteristic features: lobular arrangement, vacuolated cytoplasm, hyperchromatic nuclei, positive staining for lipid (oil red O)
supportive: Clinical presentation: atypical chalazia, yellow eyelid thickening, unresponsive blepharitis/conjunctivitis
